page.title: 10Industry_Water Supply
page.content: Lamaload Reservoir,built in the early 1960s,was constructed to supplement the existing water supply to the Borough of Macclesfield.Its round headed buttress dam wall,reaching to a height of one hundred and forty three feet,spans the valley of the River Dean,just below its headwaters,with an overall length of six hundred and ten feet.Below ground,the concrete wall descends for one hundred and twenty feet and steel pins,set in it,go down even further still.One hundred and twenty six thousand tons of concrete were used in the construction of this wall and also set inside it are huge rubber stoppers which prevent water seepage.To ensure absolute safety, horizontal wires are strung internally across the wall,which record the slightest stress movement.
